cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 235 miles E of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Turning WNW then NW, forecast to pass near the northeastern coast of Honduras, cross the Yucatan Peninsula Saturday night, enter the south-central Gulf of Mexico Sunday, and continue north toward the Louisiana Gulf Coast early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Honduras/Nicaragua border westward to Punta Castilla, including the Bay Islands (Honduras)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula of Mexico and northern Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama, including Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible as the system approaches on 25 Aug.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 2–4 ft surge above ground level along the lower Mississippi River delta and Plaquemines coastline.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could produce 4–8 inches of rainfall with locally higher amounts, causing flash-flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High waves and dangerous rip currents may require early suspension of vessel movements and offshore operations.
